result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric E. Chitwood was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While under Influence (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
OWI 5th

Conditions of probation:

Pay costs of supervision and court costs.

Do not possess or consume alcohol.  Submit to tests of blood, breath or urine at the request of law enforcement officer or corrections officer to monitor compliance.

Attend, cooperate with, and successfully complete any AODA, counseling or treatment programs as ordered by the agent.  AODA/driver safety plan to be relicensed.

Do not enter into any bars or taverns.

Obtain corrective thinking assessment within 30 days.

Provide DNA sample (fee is waived). 

1 day credit for time served in the event of revocation. 

Conditional jail time of 6 months.  With work release/huber and stayed until on or before Sunday, March 20, 2011 between 6-7 a.m.

Retroactive to the date of administrative suspension.
Concurrent with: Retroactive to the date of administrative suspension.
Driver Safety Plan to be relicensed.

timeConds.notes: With work release/huber and stayed until on or before Sunday, March 20, 2011 between 6-7 a.m.

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: ADA Forehand, Def, and Atty. Cohen.  Counsel note that there had been a jt recommendation in this matter prior to receipt of the PSI.  Counsel have stipulated that the defense is now free to argue the details of the sentence.  Court accepts PSI recommendation and orders sentence withheld for probation of 3 years.  Conditions:  Pay costs of supervision and court costs, do not possess/consume alcohol, submit to tests of blood, breath or urine at request of law enforcement officer or corrections officer to monitor compliance, attend/cooperate in/success. complete any aoda, counseling or treatment programs as ordered, not to enter into any bars or taverns, obtain corrective thinking assessment within 30 days, provide DNA sample (fee is waived).  $600 plus costs, assts and fees.  36 mo revocation.  AODA to be relicensed.  IID for 12 mo after relicensing.  1 day credit for time served in the event of revocation.  DL revocation effective with date of admin. suspension.  Def to sign up today for probation.  6 mo conditional jail time is stayed til Sunday, March 20, 2011 between 6-7 a.m.
Sentencing hearing on March 17, 2011 at 02:00 pm.

ADA Forehand, Def, and Atty. Cohen.  Cohen states def will enter a plea of guilty today; says that the jt recommendation is for 2 years probation with 9 mo jail as a condition; also forfeiture, 36 mo revocation, aoda, and IID.  Forehand concurs.  Def concurs.  Def pleads guilty to OWI 5th.  Court's colloquy on plea.  .257 blood test.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing set by JA for 45 minutes.  3-17-11 at 2:00.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 03-17-2011 at 02:00 pm.
Plea hearing on December 15, 2010 at 10:00 am.

ADA Forehand, Def, and Atty. Cohen.  Cohen states resolution that's been reached; details the resolution and asks for sentencing date in the future.  Forehand does not object.  Matter is continued til plea hearing on Dec. 15th.  Bail is continued.  Plea hearing scheduled for 12-15-2010 at 10:00 am.
Questionairre and waiver
Status hearing on October 6, 2010 at 10:00 am.

ADA Forehand, Def and Att. Cohen appear in person.  Court states hearing was currently scheduled for 2:30pm and counsel informed court on 07-14-2010 that prelim will be waived.  Court finds that the pre-lim questionairre & waiver has been signed by def today.  Court questions Def.  Court reads Prelim waiver. Court finds the waiver is freely, involuntarily and intelligently made.  A Status hrg will be set 10-06-10 at 10 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 15, 2010 at 02:30 pm.

ADA Forehand in court; Def in court; Atty. Cohen by phone by prior authorization of the court due to appearance in another court at this time.  Cohen addresses the Court re status; has ordered a video from the squad car but hasn't received it yet.  Forehand - there is no video in the county cars.  Cohen asks the Court for 30 more days for matters related to discovery.  Court - need to proceed with prelim unless it's going to be waived.  Forehand estimates 45 minutes.  JA sets 45 minute stacked prelim for July 15th at 2:30.  Bail is continued with no drink and test on demand conditions.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 07-15-2010 at 02:30 pm.
Status conference on May 12, 2010 at 02:30 pm.

DA Sharp, Def, and Atty. Cohen.  Formal reading waived; Cohen requests prelim; time limits waived.  Court accepts waiver of time limits for prelim.  Cohen asks for status in lieu of prelim scheduling at this time.  Bail is continued with no drink/test on demand condition.  Status conference scheduled for 05-12-2010 at 02:30 pm.
to Those Posting Cash Bond
Adjourned initial appearance on March 17, 2010 at 02:30 pm.

ADA Forehand and Def without counsel.  Def states he hasn't hired counsel yet but hopes to by the end of this week.  Once counsel is retained, Court states they must file proper retainer.  Bail is continued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for 03-17-2010 at 02:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on February 3, 2010 at 01:30 pm.
ADA Forehand and Def without counsel.  Formal reading waived.  Def states he plans to have an attorney.  Matter is adjourned.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for 02-03-2010 at 01:30 pm.
Minutes
